title: A deserted rail station on Trump's route to peace where global interests collide
summary:
"We are on the Trump route, also known as Crossroads of Peace, the Silk Road, and the Zangezur Corridor," says Marut Vanyan, a local journalist.
Trump's intervention could reshape the geopolitics of a region that Russia claims as its sphere of influence.
Marut Vanyan stands close to the Aras river that separates Armenia from IranA future Trump route promises both "unimpeded connectivity" for Azerbaijan and "full respect" for Armenia's sovereignty.
Both nations' leaders say the Washington meeting has restored peace in their region and praise Trump's intervention as a game changer.
The Aras River that separates the Islamic Republic and Armenia is the very line the route is set follow.

title: British parts found in Russian drones, Zelesnky says
summary:
British parts found in Russian drones, Zelensky says"We take reports of goods from UK companies being found in Russian weaponry incredibly seriously," a government spokesperson said.
The Ukrainian president called for further "effective" sanctions after saying parts originating in allied countries including Germany, Japan and the US have been identified in Russian weapons.
British microcomputers were among more than 100,000 foreign-made parts contained in Russian missiles and drones used in Sunday's deadly strikes on Ukraine , Volodymyr Zelensky has said.
Components originating in China, Taiwan and the Netherlands have also been identified in Russian weapons, he continued.
Since Russia launched its full-scale invasion of Ukraine in February 2022, it has become the most-sanctioned nation in the world.

title: China angered at EU 'challenging' UN resolution that led to Taiwan leaving global body
summary:
China and Taiwan, which Beijing views as its own territory, have been locked in an increasingly bitter dispute about U.N. resolution 2758.
China's Foreign Ministry said the EU remarks were a "distortion" of the resolution.
Advertisement AdvertisementAdvertisement Advertisement"United Nations Resolution 2758 is very short - only 150 words.
And among those 150 words, the word 'Taiwan' does not appear," an EU spokesperson said in an emailed statement.
In response, China's foreign ministry said that it was "extremely dissatisfied and resolutely opposed" to the EU remarks.

title: Will Trump’s Gaza Peace Plan Work?
summary:
But Donald Trump's 20-point peace plan - which Israel has agreed to and Hamas has partly agreed to - is really just a framework, only a few pages long.
Adam talks to Lyse Doucet, chief international correspondent, about how the next few days could play out?

title: One iPhone led police to gang who sent 40,000 snatched phones to China
summary:
Police believe the gang could be responsible for exporting up to half of all phones stolen in London, where most mobiles are taken in the UK.
The investigation was triggered after a victim traced a stolen phone last year.
Inside, officers found devices wrapped in foil - an attempt by offenders to transport stolen devices undetected.
Three-quarters of all the phones stolen in the UK are now taken in London.
"We've dismantled criminal networks at every level from street-level thieves to international organised crime groups exporting tens of thousands of stolen devices each year."

title: What to know about the Tomahawk cruise missiles Trump says he might give Ukraine
summary:
President Donald Trump said he has made a decision about whether to send Tomahawk cruise missiles to Ukraine.
President Donald Trump said he has made a decision about whether to send Tomahawk cruise missiles to Ukraine.
Mark Wilson/Getty ImagesPresident Donald Trump said he has made a decision about whether to send Tomahawk cruise missiles to Ukraine.
Mark Wilson/Getty ImagesThe US is signaling it may send Tomahawk cruise missiles to Ukraine, which would hand Kyiv a powerful American long-range strike weapon with significant reach.
Tomahawk missiles have become the latest high-profile weapon sought by Ukraine from Western partners.

summary:
Surprises can be fun when you’re on vacation, except when they take the form of massive roaming charges on your cellular bill after you get home.
Roamless works exactly as its name suggests — it’s a global all-in-one eSIM app that keeps you safely connected across all your travels, with transparent prepaid or pay-as-you-go pricing.
If you have a physical SIM card right now, you also know how tiny, fragile, and easy to lose they are.
Both methods are managed on the Roamless app, without worrying about swapping out SIM cards as you cross international borders.

title: Italy's Meloni says she has been denounced to ICC for complicity in genocide
summary:
By Angelo AmanteROME (Reuters) -Italian Prime Minister Giorgia Meloni said on Tuesday that she and two of her ministers had been reported to the International Criminal Court for alleged complicity in genocide in connection with Israel's offensive in Gaza.
Speaking in an interview with state television broadcaster RAI, Meloni said Defence Minister Guido Crosetto and Foreign Minister Antonio Tajani had been denounced, and "I think" also Roberto Cingolani, the head of defence group Leonardo.
Advertisement AdvertisementAdvertisement Advertisement"I don't believe there is another case like this in the world or in history," Meloni said.
Meloni said she was "amazed" by the accusation of complicity in genocide because "anyone who knows the situation is aware that Italy has not authorised new, let's say, arms supplies to Israel after October 7."
Advertisement AdvertisementAdvertisement AdvertisementIn other remarks, Meloni said she believed that U.S. President Donald Trump had come to the conclusion that Russia was not interested in a peace deal with Ukraine.
